print('''%html\n

Setup and Access Data

''')

msg.data: Setup and Access Data

paragraphs.title: Install Library
paragraphs.text:
%python

!pip install -U imbalanced-learn

paragraphs.title: Import Libraries
paragraphs.text:
%python

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import classification_report
from sklearn.metrics import confusion_matrix
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from keras.models import Sequential
from keras.layers import Dense
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

import imblearn
from imblearn.over_sampling import SMOTE

import snowflake.connector

paragraphs.title: Interactive Notebook Inputs
paragraphs.text:
%python
# Set datasource name to be used as a variable in future paragraphs
datasource = z.textbox("Data Source Name","LAB_01")

# Create an input field to select from different tables
table = z.textbox("Database Table Name", "ANOMALY_DETECTION")
                                
print("Datasource:", datasource) 
print("Database Table:", table)

paragraphs.title: Connect to Snowflake (hard coded)
paragraphs.text:
%python
con = snowflake.connector.connect(
  account="zepl_partner",
  warehouse="LAB_WH",
  database="CUSTOMER_LABS",
  schema="LAB_01",
  user="LAB_USER",
  password="zepL_lab_User",
  role="LAB_ROLE"
)

cur = con.cursor()

paragraphs.title: Connect to Snowflake (Zepl)
paragraphs.text:
%python

# Create connection to Snowflake and return a SnowflakeCursor object
cur = z.getDatasource(datasource)

paragraphs.title: Run Query on Snowflake Data
paragraphs.text:
%python

# Create SQL to push down to Snowflake
sql = 'SELECT * FROM ' + table

# Execute SQL in Snowflake
res = cur.execute(sql)

# Return results into a Pandas DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(res)
df.columns = [col[0] for col in cur.description]

paragraphs.title: Handle NULL Values
paragraphs.text:
%python
# Remove NULL Values from our dataset
df.drop('NAMEORIG', axis=1, inplace=True)
df.drop('NAMEDEST', axis=1, inplace=True)
df.drop('ISFLAGGEDFRAUD', axis=1, inplace=True)

print('Null Values =',df.isnull().values.any())

msg.data: Model and Evaluation

paragraphs.title: Train / Test / OverSample to Balance our Dataset
paragraphs.text:
%python

# Import libraries for OverSampling
import imblearn
from imblearn.over_sampling import SMOTE

# List of fields to use as features for training
X = df2.drop(['ISFRAUD'],axis=1)

# Value to predict (ISFRAUD)
y = df2['ISFRAUD']

# Create Train / Test Split
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3, random_state=0)

# OverSample to balance dataset
sm = SMOTE(random_state=10, sampling_strategy=1.0)

# Balanced training dataset
x_train_res, y_train_res = sm.fit_sample(X_train, y_train)

%python #Splitting the data into training and test print() print('''%html\n

Before OverSampling, counts of label '1': {0:.2f}

'''.format(sum(y_train==1))) print('''%html\n

Before OverSampling, counts of label '0': {0:.2f}

'''.format(sum(y_train==0)))

%python print() print('''%html\n

After OverSampling, the shape of train_X: {}

'''.format(x_train_res.shape)) print('''%html\n

After OverSampling, the shape of train_y: {}

'''.format(y_train_res.shape))

%python print() print('''%html\n

After OverSampling, counts of label '1': {0:.2f}

'''.format(sum(y_train_res==1))) print('''%html\n

After OverSampling, counts of label '0' {0:.2f}

'''.format(sum(y_train_res==0)))

paragraphs.title: Scaling
paragraphs.text:
%python
# Feature scaling 
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

sc = StandardScaler()
x_train_scaled = sc.fit_transform(x_train_res)
x_test_scaled = sc.transform(X_test)

# Initializing the model 
model = Sequential()

#Adding the input layer and the first hidden layer 
model.add(Dense(input_dim=11, output_dim = 6, init = 'uniform', activation = 'relu'))

#Adding the second hidden layer 
model.add(Dense(output_dim = 6, init = 'uniform', activation = 'relu'))

#Adding the output layer 
model.add(Dense(output_dim = 1, init = 'uniform', activation = 'sigmoid'))

#Compiling and fitting the model 
model.compile(optimizer = 'adam', loss = 'binary_crossentropy', metrics = ['accuracy'])
model_info = model.fit(x_train_scaled, y_train_res, batch_size = 10, nb_epoch = 10)

paragraphs.title: Visualize Accuracy / Loss
paragraphs.text:
%python

#Plotting the training curves
def plot_model_history(model_history):
    fig, axs = plt.subplots(1,2,figsize=(15,5))
    # summarize history for accuracy
    axs[0].plot(range(1,len(model_history.history['accuracy'])+1),model_history.history['accuracy'])
    #axs[0].plot(range(1,len(model_history.history['val_acc'])+1),model_history.history['val_acc'])
    axs[0].set_title('Model Accuracy')
    axs[0].set_ylabel('Accuracy')
    axs[0].set_xlabel('Epoch')
    axs[0].set_xticks(np.arange(1,len(model_history.history['accuracy'])+1),len(model_history.history['accuracy'])/10)
    axs[0].legend(['train', 'val'], loc='best')
    # summarize history for loss
    axs[1].plot(range(1,len(model_history.history['loss'])+1),model_history.history['loss'])
    #axs[1].plot(range(1,len(model_history.history['val_loss'])+1),model_history.history['val_loss'])
    axs[1].set_title('Model Loss')
    axs[1].set_ylabel('Loss')
    axs[1].set_xlabel('Epoch')
    axs[1].set_xticks(np.arange(1,len(model_history.history['loss'])+1),len(model_history.history['loss'])/10)
    axs[1].legend(['train', 'val'], loc='best')
    plt.show()

plot_model_history(model_info)

paragraphs.title: Visualize Prediction Results
paragraphs.text:
%python

# Predicting the test results 
y_pred = model.predict_classes(x_test_scaled)
acc = accuracy_score(y_test,y_pred) * 100

# Generating the Confusion matrix and Classification report
print('Confusion matrix', '\n', confusion_matrix(y_test, y_pred), '\n')
print('Classification report', '\n', classification_report(y_test, y_pred), '\n')

%python print('''%html\n

Accuracy: {0:.2f}

'''.format( round(acc,2) ))
